title.native: 青の祓魔師 終夜篇

description:
Sequel to Ao no Exorcist: Yuki no Hate-hen.

Yukio parts ways with Rin and makes his way to the Illuminati. In order to face Yukio, who is seeking strength and the truth, Rin decides that he must learn the secret of their birth. With Mephisto’s guidance, he embarks on a journey to the past.

Rin traces the footsteps of their adoptive father, Shirou Fujimoto, and birth mother, Yuri Egin. But the path they took in life was harsher than Rin could have ever imagined….

Why were children born between the Demon God Satan and a human? What was the Blue Night? And when Rin learns everything, what will be his answer?

(Source: Official Site)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3298914906)

Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/). Started off as a production manager.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [illustrator](https://anilist.co/staff/122887/)._
**Shimizu Tomoyuki (清水友幸)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohta_yamabook) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamabook_kohta/) | [Website](https://www.kohtayamamoto.net/)

Formerly affiliated with Legendoor, he is now in business partnership with VV-ALKLINE.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**
**Aoki Makoto (青木誠)** is a Japanese production manager and animation producer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106669804) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amazarashiofficial) | [Website](http://www.amazarashi.com)

A mysterious band led by singer [Hiromu Akita](https://anilist.co/staff/159938).

__Label:__ Sony Music Japan (Since 2022)

__[Website](https://shiyui.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shiyui_0111) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/72320879) |[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXgMg81GVAzdFWQNJFKiJgQ) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/117211278) | [Spotify (Shiyui)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/16ROxNSgWNSQIuIO8gNQyz) | [Spotify (シユイ)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3EKiz61ZCQs4LK3O96mt5O)__

__Shiyui__ is a Japanese singer and Illustrator.
